Row.Text: The son of Mundzuk greets you. Tread lightly across my land, and you may be safe yet from my horse's iron hooves.
You are in the presence of Attila, scourge of Rome. Do not let hubris be your downfall as well.
Welcome stranger to my domain. I am Attila the Hun - be wary of crossing me lest your wealth end up here at my feet.
Do not forget who you are dealing with.
I value a backbone in my chieftains, but you presume too much.
Try that again, and I'll add your gold to my riches as well.
Remember this could have been avoided. Your people will not support you long in repeated attempts at self-destruction.
Your lesson is learned, I hope. Perhaps I shall liberate you of your fanciest silver to ensure you remember.
I am not too proud to blindly ignore defeat. Only a fool gloats over one victory.
Sometimes a loss occurs despite the best attempt at preparation. The next round may not go so smoothly for you.
My people will mourn me not with tears but with the blood of men. I may be gone, but one will rise to take my place.
You may have taken my lands and scattered my armies, but the Huns are proud and strong. They will not accept a weak ruler.
It is easy to take a land by force but not to rule it. You have won half the battle, but the hardest part is yet to come.
Good day to you.
Greetings.
Until we meet again.
Goodbye.
A fine deal.
This will not feed my men nor my horses. Improve your offer.
Can you do a little better?
That's not quite good enough.
Almost...
I am not interested.
Rejoice that my attention is urgently needed elsewhere. Else I might not be so forgiving.
You seem to have learned your bargaining techniques from Roman thieves. No.
My army is in need of supplies - this can be profitable for us both.
Hrm, I feel my pile of riches grows boring. You can add to it now, or I can take what I like of yours later.
All right.
Very Well.
I must refuse.
No.
Let's hear it.
Go ahead.
Greetings.
Welcome.
Until we meet again.
Farewell, friend.
A sound agreement!
Ha, even the Romans wouldn't dare present an offer like this. Try again, friend.
Surely you can't do a little better?
You're almost there...
Thank you, but we'll pass.
Why, certainly. Aid for one helps us all in the end.
My resources are all tied up abroad. I am afraid you're on your own.
See, I've cleared out a spot of honor for your belongings. How can you refuse such privilege?
Come, there are many great treaties to be drawn!
Certainly.
Certainly not.
That's unacceptable.
Proceed.
I'm listening.
Oh, it's you.
What do you want?
That is all.
Go away now.
Deal.
I can feel the bile rising in my throat, but I will let you improve your offer at my advisors' behest.
That's not good enough.
You must do better than that.
Almost...
You seek to steal from me in front of my own men? Begone, beggar!
You may have the upper hand at the moment, but this will not always be the case.
Be warned - you sign your death warrant with this foolishness.
You will contribute to my amassed wealth. There is a spot open near my feet.
This is better than you deserve, but let it not be said that I am an unfair man.
Fine. Agreed.
You are mad!
That's unacceptable.
You cannot be serious!
Yes?
Honoria's bride-price must be met! This land is mine, whether you give it freely or not.
Rome's forces have splintered like twigs against my army's flanks, how will you stand? My horsemen will pound you into the earth.
I grow tired of this throne. I think I should like to have yours instead.
Curse you, you vile Roman cur! I'll have your head before the day is done.
I would have expected this treachery from Rome, not from you. No matter, you all bleed red.
I thought you useless yet you prove me wrong. You've become an excellent example for how to die.
